KFranks@... wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'd like to use Heritrix but I cannot seem to get around this issue:
> 
> I have 100k seed urls. These have been split into 4k subsets. A 
> Heritrix process is assigned a 4k seed url set, an ip address and 
> port. For Heritrix 1.0.4 AND 1.2.0 (yes I tried 1.4.0 first - with 
> 1.4.0 I ran into some threading issues with jdk1.5.0) versions I had 
> initial success, however after modifying timeouts and bringing the toe 
> thread count down to 5 from 100 I have not yet been able to execute an 
> extended crawl beyond just a few hours??? Every Heritrix process just 
> sits there, hanging.

I would definitely run Heritrix 1.4 in preference to 1.0.4 and 1.2.

What sort of threading issues came up with Sun 1.5 JVM?

Heritrix 1.4 does not require Java 1.5; it should run with the Sun
and IBM 1.4.2 JVMs.

> Please review the order.xml config file I made below and send your 
> pointers at will as My team would like to continue to use Heritrix for 
> a web wide vertical biomedical search engine but I have to resolve 
> this issue quickly now as I've spent days trying to work around it so 
> far with little success. Thank You.
> 
> In a nutshell, why is Heritrix hanging without downloading only after 
> a few hours given the order.xml file below?
> 
>   - JVM: SUNWappserver jdk1.4

I'm unfamiliar with what 'SUNWappserver' would mean here; is this any
different from Sun's plain JDK 1.4.2 JVM?

>   - RedHat 2.4

We've run into a variety of problems with Linux threads hanging on
all but the latest "NPTL"-based threading libraries (associated with
glibc 3.2.4 or later).

A Java thread dump could help determine if this is the case in your
situation.

>   - Crawling is autolaunched

Does this mean, from the command-line, using the '-r/--run' option and
a supplied ORDER_FILE?

>   - Crawling happens before the hang, approx 30k docs downloaded.
>   - what a java thread dump (generated with SIGQUIT) shows
>   


> ===
> 
> 
> When I click on "Reports" this is what I get:
> 
> 
> An error occured
> java.util.NoSuchElementException
> java.util.NoSuchElementException
> 	at java.util.TreeMap.key(TreeMap.java:431)
> 	at java.util.TreeMap.firstKey(TreeMap.java:286)
> 	at java.util.TreeSet.first(TreeSet.java:404)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToePool.oneLineReport
> (ToePool.java:111)
> 	at 

That's odd. This happens every time you click 'Reports'?

> 
> ===
> 
> a tail of the "local-errors.log" file:

That output isn't much concern -- just typical transient connection
failures. Is there anything in runtime-errors.log?

I suspect JVM threading problems on your 2.4-based-kernel. The Java
SIGQUIT thread dump from the hung state would help recognize if your
hang is like others we've seen due to Linux threading issues.

- Gordon @ IA
